You check over and over that the map provided by the locals truly points in this direction. NL #b~Now,~ #b~choose~ #b~a~ #b~way~ #b~to~ #b~move~ #b~on~

samirg:LostAndFound.NAME: Lost and Found
DESCRIPTIONS: A huge clan tree sits submerged in a swamp, with Sami traders all over the trunks, the roots, and by the banks. Branches move back and forth between the stalls, as animals cry out to peddle goods or transmit information. Wooden puppets trudge between the ground and swamp to store their cargo. Everything just feels so exotic!
A puppet fully covered in vines emerges from the swamp and takes away your item as it also drags a chest out from the water, placing the item you picked inside.

You obtain much needed supplies from the Sami people and can now continue your expedition. Before you leave, you let an accompanying research team member take a few more photos, so you'll have something to silence your skeptical associates with when you brag about this later.
This place is just too strange, so you quickly urge the research team members to leave.

But there is no one groaning or cursing. They are like the forest itself: silent, and yet powerful. You wish to go up and talk to him, and hand him the Foldartal. But after he sees the woodcut in your hands from afar, he orders the warriors to rise and continue marching across the snowfield.  NL ~All~ ~that~ ~is~ ~left~ ~for~ ~you~ ~is~ ~a~ ~messy~ ~camp~

samirg:SadCage.NAME: Pessimist's Cage
DESCRIPTIONS: The route Valarqvin drew for you leads you to a huge cave. There are no light sources at all, and Valarqvin stops you from any attempt to light a lamp or turn on a flashlight. All you can do is hold her hand and move forward step by step. When you finally see light again, you spot an altar with a flower atop: rootless, blooming, and incomparably sharp. Many Cyclopes are sitting around the altar, and they are silent as they "stare" at the flower in front of them. NL ~"Your~ ~path~ ~will~ ~be~ ~darker~ ~than~ ~the~ ~one~ ~you~ ~have~ ~just~ ~traveled,"~ Valarqvin says to herself. ~"If~ ~you~ ~can~ ~still~ ~walk,~ ~then~ ~pick~ ~up~ ~the~ ~flower."~ NL #bAs #bshe #butters #bthe #bvery #blast #bword, #ball #bthe #BCyclopes #blook #btowards #byou.

You reach out to hold it. But you don't even manage to touch it. You try to focus your mind on the flower, but soon feel your head spinning... You try many methods to move the flower even a bit, but it is all in vain‚Äîand just as your head is in chaos, its roots take hold in your mind. "Virtual earth, a rootless flower, the key to the other side," Valarqvin mumbles to herself. You still don't manage to touch the flower, but its position relative to you is fixed. You can "take" it "away" . NL ~The~ ~Cyclopes~ ~raise~ ~their~ ~heads~ ~and~ ~whisper~ ~as~ ~they~ ~watch~ ~you~ ~and~ ~Valarqvin~ ~leave.~

"Then let us return, this path is not an easy one to walk." Valarqvin brings you back to the team, and it feels like none of this happened at all. The Cyclopes remain silent the whole time. NL ~For~ ~some~ ~reason~ ~you~ ~feel~ ~a~ ~lot~ ~lighter~ ~inside.~

DESCRIPTIONS: Many years have passed since the giant facility at the end of the icefield was discovered, and many great things have happened since then: #b"Spire #bIcefield #bMegastructure #bResearch #band #bRestoration #bConvention" ‚Äî‚Äîthe birth of the Black Hole Protocol, the Feranmut Sami's departure, and a spike in technological advancements brought by Collapsal research. That's when you notice an unfamiliar figure in camp that no one else seems to perceive.

You subconsciously pull out the invitation and hand it over to him. He takes a look, nods, and turns around before vanishing before your eyes. You seem to catch a glimpse of the Rhodes Island logo and a bone pen as he disappears. However, the very next moment you find yourself in the sands of Sargon. samirg:Reconstruction.NAME: Reconstruction
DESCRIPTIONS: By the time your squad arrives at the camp, everything else is already ready. You hand Kal'tsit the materials, and she separates them before distributing them to every department. As the instruments sound, the scientists take their positions, and the gigantic megastructure restoration project officially begins. In phase one, expeditioners have to clean up the Collapsals and eradicate their influence on the ring-shaped megastructure.

After eradicating the Collapsal menace, we need to investigate the megastructure and attached buildings, simultaneously repairing any damage done with Terran materials and activating the dimensional stabilizers originally used to deal with Crazelyseon. With the Sami Snowpriests' assistance and the analysis and application of the Elves' prehistoric knowledge, we should be able to completely stabilize the disorderly dimensional currents and ensure our investigations and repairs will not be interrupted.

Restoration and on-site cleanup is complete. Finally, we have to decipher the connection between the megastructure and the various operating devices in the surrounding buildings. Columbian researchers, Leithanian Casters, Sami Shamans, and a few squads of Sarkaz proficient in witchcraft work together to overcome this final problem. On the other hand, the engineers have to figure out how to power the enormous complex.

The entire facility has been repaired, and the megastructure restarts. The rootless garden is flooded with starlight, and the ring now displays a serene cavity. The door is already open, quietly awaiting its visitors. The supplies, personnel, and contingency plans are all ready to go, and you will be the first to go through the gate.

samirg:CureRitual.NAME: Ceremony of Healing
DESCRIPTIONS: This funerary fleet is performing some sort of rite. Drums beat to a rhythm as people bend down to kiss the water, whispering prayers for the spirits and the sun's rays. The host invites you to do as the locals do.

The ice-cold water wets your lips and you suddenly feel relaxed, as though you've never experienced such a peaceful moment ever since you set foot on Sami soil. You want to understand the science of the ritual by analyzing the water's properties, but the equipment falls into the water as you quietly try to take a sample. All the locals look up at you, and you know that you should leave at once.

After the ceremony concludes, you learn that in recent years the locals have been disturbed by huge shadows in their dreams. Can a rite like this really improve their situation? As soon as you make your question, you feel dizzy from the water you drank. The locals are quite critical of your attitude, but give you an item as a token of their care.

You have heard of this rite that calms the mind and grants courage against evil spirits, but you still don't know what exactly these evil spirits the Sami see really are. Confident in the research team's equipment and supplies, you decline their invitation.
